text:
Hi all, 
 
I have the following problem with Apache-2.0.48 running perchild MPM: Two 
"ChildPerUserID" directives in my httpd.conf file: 
 
ChildPerUserID  lala    lala    2 
ChildPerUserID  test    test    2 
 
and of course "ServerLimit" and "NumServers" before. Then I have two vhosts: 
 
<VirtualHost 192.168.19.14> 
    AssignUserID lala lala 
    ServerName lala.com 
    ... 
</VirtualHost> 
 
<VirtualHost 192.168.19.14> 
    AssignUserID test test 
    ServerName test.com 
    ... 
</VirtualHost> 
 
When I now start apache, I get NO errors on console or error log, and I can 
access my first virtual host "lala.com". But if I try to access "test.com" 
(both set in /etc/hosts file), I get no response from server, like a timeout. 
 
If I switch those ChildPerUserID directives (so line with "test" as first 
entry), then I can access virtual domain "test.com", but not "lala.com" ... 
so only the first entry seems to be valid. 
 
How can I solve this issue? Is this perchild module marked as stable, or still 
in development phase? 
 
Greetings and TIA, Matthias 
 
PS: I can see httpd processes running via "ps", both as "lala" and as "test".
creator: haim@gentoo.org
trawick@apache.org
text:
In case it isn't obvious, no Apache developers have done any work with perchild
in quite a long time, other than trying to keep perchild up to date with changes
that have been made to the other MPMs.  Please consider the current experimental
module  as a proving ground for some good ideas, but something that should be
left alone by folks not interested in debugging problems in it.
